floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council, Hampshire

items.message:
Flooding is possible as the river, and its streams are rising, due to prolonged, heavy rain. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible.
Areas most at risk include tributaries between Ringwood and Christchurch.
Further rainfall is forecast throughout the evening and into tomorrow which may raise levels further.
We are closely monitoring the situation and monitoring rainfall and river levels.
Consider activating any property flood protection products.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 3:06 PM on 06/09/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Scrase Bridge and West Common Streams

floodArea.riverOrSea: Scrase Bridge Stream, West Common Stream

items.message: The Scrasebridge and West Common Streams is high and rising.  In the last 12 hours, 20mm of rain has been recorded at Haywards Heath. From 14:30 05/09/2024 minor flooding could affect a small number of commercial properties on Bridge Road and residential properties on West Common Road. Odd numbered properties from 29 to 47 on Meadow Drive could be affected by flooding. A further 10mm of rain is expected over the next 8 hours.  The river should begin to fall by 19:00 on 05/09/2024, and should return to normal from 20:00. Flood impacts should begin to slowly ease when river levels start to fall. If you see a blockage affecting the flow in the river on Bridge Road or Hickmans Lane, please call our incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60. We are clearing debris from grilles through Lindfield, including the Builders Centre and Witch Inn, to help keep the river flowing freely and reduce flood risk. We will update this message by 21:00 05/09/2024.
